column1: #SmallBusinesses continue to be impacted by #COVID19. But they work every day to serve their communities and keep workers on payroll.  #SmallBizSat is an important reminder that as we celebrate the holidays we must support small businesses! #ShopLocal #ShopSmall https://t.co/qKfwHhryqs https://t.co/ABlgFn7UvK

Our final #SmallBizSat Stop: Evans on the Common in #Townsend!  Founded by Gary Evans 36 years ago this wonderful footwear outdoor equipment and clothing store is home to a historic building originally constructed as a schoolhouse almost 150 YEARS AGO! #ShopLocal #ShopSmall https://t.co/WfmaxfCuAN https://t.co/8SADvvPg1B

We stayed in #Marlborough for #SmallBizSat Stop #3: @PostRdArtCenter!  I was able to shop for gifts for my girls online & pick them up curbside! In addition to owning this #SmallBiz Randi is also a volunteer judge for our #MA3 Congressional Art Competition! #ShopLocal #ShopSmall https://t.co/Hdj2i3P2jD https://t.co/ezOqBM1fM3

#SmallBizSat Stop #2: @WordStreetBooks!  What an incredible store for children’s books and gifts. I can’t tell you how excited I am to give my girls these children’s books on @JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris for Christmas this year! #ShopLocal #ShopSmall https://t.co/EULXARKuoW https://t.co/ndHJkdlrnf
Brew’d is a staple in our community just like the thousands of small businesses across our district that need our support now more than ever. #ShopLocal #ShopSmall https://t.co/VK1Bhpix0G

#SmallBizSat Stop #1: @brewdawakening in #Lowell!  Had to start off the day with some delicious coffee & snacks. Grateful to Brew’d owner Andy who reached out to our team earlier this year for help with an SBA loan to keep paying his workers. https://t.co/864rB0JeOC

While #SmallBizSat looks a little bit different this year we are determined to support our small businesses and keep our local economy thriving. Follow along here as I visit some incredible small businesses in #MA3! #ShopLocal #ShopSmall https://t.co/H1FQnerjaR

This #NativeAmericanHeritageDay I’m grateful for the incredible Native American members I have the honor of serving with.  Their experiences are invaluable & I look forward to continuing our work making our nation a better place for everyone to call home. https://t.co/wovt8zAhP7
@RepSusieLee So sorry for your loss @RepSusieLee

To our heroes on the front lines and to those of you who have continuously done your part to slow the spread of this virus and ensure that they are able to continue doing their jobs: THANK YOU!  I hope you and your family have a safe and happy #Thanksgiving! https://t.co/Zu79UaH02W https://t.co/ttLLrONFD9

Like so many in our community I’ve felt the stress exhaustion and sadness that has been brought about by COVID-19.  But I’ve also seen the incredible acts of selflessness & kindness that have shone through this dark time.  I’m so thankful to each of you who continue to step up. https://t.co/YdFv2WYyHs

This #Thanksgiving I’m thinking of the more than 10500 families here in Massachusetts who are missing a loved one at their dinner table or on their family zoom call.  I’m thinking of the health care workers and first responders skipping the holiday so they can save lives.

This Thanksgiving feels different for us but we are staying busy this year and my girls want to share what they have planned. I want to hear what you and your family have planned for a safe adjusted celebration this year let us know in the comments! https://t.co/ZJoBVzyXM0

It’s hardly a surprise that Donald Trump has chosen to finish his time in office the same way he started it:  Subverting the rule of law abusing the power of the presidency and rewarding his cronies after they’re caught breaking the law. https://t.co/DMKc9DJzuQ

Couldn’t have picked a more beautiful fall day than yesterday to join @Jbet26 his Beating All Odds Foundation @officialtownliv and leaders in Lawrence to distribute 1400 turkeys and 40000 pounds of fresh produce to families.  Grateful to everyone who made this possible! https://t.co/dhTqCGuty4

I’m old enough to remember when Steven Mnuchin wouldn’t agree to a relief deal until he got a $500 billion slush fund.  How convenient that he now thinks Janet Yellen needs to be told by Mitch McConnell how to spend relief funds to stimulate the economy. https://t.co/mowiX8G9de

As we commemorate International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women we must acknowledge the tragic reality that 1 in 4 women in America experience #DomesticViolence.  #DomesticViolence has no place in the world. We can #EndDV but it will take all of us.

Reminder that almost HALF of all Americans don’t own stocks.  They don’t give a damn about a good day for the Dow. They’re too busy worrying about how they're going to feed their families or keep them housed.  They need relief and they need it now. https://t.co/RCeBfro2xG

https://t.co/6Oogi4NrbN

Happy Birthday President-elect @JoeBiden!  In 61 days our nation will be guided by your steadfast leadership. It can’t come soon enough. https://t.co/l9liZomng6

Today the State Senate under @KarenSpilka's leadership made it clear: A woman has the final say over her body.  I'm grateful to each senator who voted for the #ROEAct. The fight isn't over yet but this is an enormous victory in the fight to protect reproductive freedom!

“This month I voted for the #HeroesAct which fixes this problem. It ensures that a household with dependents who are likely full-time students and below the age of 24 in addition to adult dependents would receive the $500 rebate amount. “-Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall https://t.co/JaPhSMOT4F
There was a loophole to this relief from CARES which left out dependents over the age of 17. That’s a lot of young people who were excluded as a result. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

An epidemic like this doesn't always follow the rule book. What we have to do is continue to drive these public health measures. -Dr. Welch of @PIH on the possibility of a second #COVID19 surge #TrahanTownHall
Right now our mission is to reopen and increase access to child care and youth programs while protecting children. -@Markdylanfuller of @MassEOHED #TrahanTownHall
It is unjust and dangerous to revive our economy at the expense of workers’ health. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

This pandemic has further exposed to us the glaring structural issues that plague our working families and vulnerable communities. Moving through and beyond this crisis we must implement policies that put our nation on the right track to an equitable system. - Rep. Trahan
It's just as important to pick up that contact tracing call as it is to wear a mask and wash your hands. -Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

Rolling out a vaccine campaign across the entire world is a huge endeavor. A wonderful landmark will the the development of the vaccine. The next landmark will be creating a rollout strategy across the world. -Dr. Welch of @PIH #TrahanTownHall

In these circumstances the science will set us free. Even if a vaccine is developed in really short order we should all take pause and allow a well-established scientific process to play out so we're sure the vaccine doesn't create more problems for us. -Dr. Welch of @PIH
“I am happy to report that #MA is working with a number of states that are our neighbors to facilitate coordination throughout the region.” - @markdylanfuller of @MassEOHED #TrahanTownHall

My conversations w/ the Governor mayors & city managers across the district further emphasize the dire need for greater aid which is why we’re pushing the Senate to come to the negotiating table & take up legislation that continues to address funding shortfalls. - Rep. Trahan

While the growth in positive COVID-19 cases has slowed throughout our country this disease still lurks in our communities.  We are not out of the woods and testing tracing & treating will be our guide to how we reopen live & work until there is a vaccine. -Rep. Trahan

The federal government needs to invest in a national testing infrastructure and Congress has appropriated funds specifically to testing as well as to our states that desperately need assistance combatting the coronavirus. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

Early on everyone needed to stay away from each other. Now that we have the capacity for contact tracing and for testing we know who needs to stay at home and for how long. - Dr. Welch of @PIH #TrahanTownHall
We want them to tell us who they've been in close contact with - within 6 feet for 15 minutes or more. - Dr. Welch of @PIH  #TrahanTownHall

Contact tracing in a public health response is the tie that binds all activities together. When we go about contact tracing the first person we speak to is someone who's tested positive for COVID.  - Dr. Welch of @PIH  #TrahanTownHall
We're in a place now that we can greatly broaden who's eligible for testing. -Dr. Welch of @PIH #TrahanTownHall

A novel virus like this - we don't yet have a vaccine or a cure. So we have to take a step back and instead of relying on those we have to take a broader view of what public health response will get us back to reopening. -Dr. Welch @PIH #TrahanTownHall

We are really leading the nation in one of the most important responses: creating the capacity necessary to reopen. That means the capacity for testing and the capacity for contact tracing. -Dr. Welch of @PIH #TrahanTownHall

The public health metrics and data are driving our decisions here. We're looking very closely at how other states are opening but it's always important to keep in mind that #COVID may have hit them harder than it hit us. -@Markdylanfuller of @MassEOHED #TrahanTownHall
“We are not thinking about dates but we are thinking about data.” @Markdylanfuller on the reopening of #Massachusetts #TrahanTownHall

I want to take a moment to acknowledge the incredible work that is happening at the local level. Local boards of health have really been the leaders and experts in contact tracing long before #COVID19 began. -Dr. Welch of @PIH #TrahanTownHall

If you have to go out in public be responsible – wear a mask and maintain a safe social distance from others. If you’re wondering what that distance is I tell my girls it’s at least one mommy or Lori Trahan of space between you and others. #TrahanTownHall

We’ve begun to flatten the curve but we’re not out of the woods yet. Every day that we do our part to slow the spread of COVID-19 is one day closer to safely reopening our state. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

The weather is getting warmer patience is wearing thin and In my home it’s getting increasingly difficult to explain to my young girls why they still can't hug their grandparents or play with friends. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

As we continue to navigate this new normal I want you to know that you’re not alone. The past seven weeks have been hard and all of us are feeling the weight of this stress on our bodies and our minds. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall
They’re such important voices on the issues so many in our community are dealing with on a daily basis and their insight is incredibly valuable.
I want to thank @MassLtGov and our expert panelists @SBA_NewEngland Wendell Davis and @LawrenceGenHosp  Deb Wilson one more time for taking the time out of their busy schedules to join us.
If anyone listening has a medical problem please contact your doctor. If it's an emergency please come to the hospital. Deborah Wilson of @LawrenceGenHosp #TrahanTownHall
Our team is meeting regularly to ensure that when we reopen it is done with the patients' needs put first.- Deborah Wilson of @LawrenceGenHosp #TrahanTownHall

The PPP is all about payroll and all about employees. Whatever loan you do get - the goal is 75% of that goes to payroll. If you use it all for rent it is going to be reduced. - - @SBA_NewEngland Administrator Wendell Davis

If you get a loan there's no requirement that you need to hire everyone back. Whatever amount is devoted to payroll that's forgiven. The question is residual. - @SBA_NewEngland Administrator Wendell Davis

Let's say you take out a loan and ultimately you cannot hire everyone back. You're able to hire a number of employees back. Whatever amount you allocate to payroll that amount will be forgiven. - @SBA_NewEngland Administrator Wendell Davis

PPP is a life-saver for many small businesses and I greatly appreciate the fact that the SBA has had to stand-up this brand new $660 billion program very fast. SBA has essentially had to build this plane while you’re flying it. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

During this pandemic transparency & accountability is crucial to saving lives & safeguarding our health care heroes. The families we represent have placed a sacred trust in nursing homes & in return should have assurance that their loved ones’ health & safety will be protected.

Together with @SenMarkey and @SenWarren I requested that CMS enact additional oversight measures to protect staff and residents at Life Care Centers and other senior living facilities from COVID-19.  - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

I became involved in the case at the Life Care Center of Nashoba Valley when local officials made us aware of the number of emergency calls made to the facility by the fire department and EMTs. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

And even in scenarios where nursing homes do everything right a highly-contagious and dangerous disease like COVID-19 puts our skilled nursing and assisted living facilities at high risk as hot spots. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall
This pandemic has highlighted the importance of nursing homes having robust plans for emergency preparedness and infectious disease control. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall
There's no question that testing is going to become a regular part of our lives in the near future. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

Antibody testing became available in MA last week. It looks for the presence of the antibodies in the blood stream. This indicates a person has had an immune response to COVID-19. - Deborah Wilson of @LawrenceGenHosp #TrahanTownHall

We would never rely on a shipment to pull into port from another country to protect our homeland or our troops and we should never repeat the mistakes made in combatting this virus. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

I have drafted legislation -- called the Pandemic Production Act -- which would allow the federal government to partner with industry the way we do for our national defense. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

This country is still the beginning of this pandemic and we must reinforce our domestic manufacturing supply chain for PPE critical medical devices testing kits and components as well as production of treatments and a vaccine.- Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

In order to treat patients and protect frontline workers states and hospitals have been locked in a bidding war competing for scarce equipment as cases multiply by the hour. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

We have a staff person that has to work full time to coordinate all the food and family donations that continue to come in. Those are the highlights of how we are trying to support our frontline workers.- Deborah Wilson of @LawrenceGenHosp #TrahanTownHall
We are very sensitive to the emotional toll that caring for such seriously ill patients can be. Mindfulness and self care are critical. - Deborah Wilson of @LawrenceGenHosp #TrahanTownHall
We are plateauing but the patients are very sick. We have about 20 new in-patient admissions each day because of COVID-19. - Deborah Wilson of @LawrenceGenHosp #TrahanTownHall

In a good year in #MA our office would do about $350 million loans. In that 12 days of round 1 more than $12 billion hit the streets for MA small businesses. -@SBA_NewEngland Administrator Wendell Davis
We want to make sure that the smallest of the small businesses get access to these funds. - @SBA_NewEngland Administrator Wendell Davis #TrahanTownHall
I am not aware of any bank in New England that is experiencing a backlog of applications. - @SBA_NewEngland Administrator Wendell Davis #TrahanTownHall
We paid out half a billion dollars in benefits for people who applied to PUA. We'll continue to serve this need as long as it exists. - @MassLtGov #TrahanTownHall
53% of our hospital beds are empty. That means we are flattening the curve. - @MassLtGov #TrahanTownHall
If you have an illness that needs to be treated you need to call your doctor and go to a hospital to get treated. - @MassLtGov #TrahanTownHall
We have had a plateauing of cases. However yesterday we had the highest number of deaths that were COVID in nature. - @MassLtGov #TrahanTownHall
We will get through this crisis but we must ensure that no one is left behind. - Rep. Trahan #TrahanTownHall

Just yesterday we got news that the Treasury and IRS will make about 60 million payments to Americans through direct deposit in mid-April. The checks will be issued in reverse “adjusted gross income” order—so those who earn the least will get their rebates first. #TrahanTownHall

The incremental reduction means that those who earn more than $99000 will receive no recovery rebate. Similarly couples who file taxes jointly and earn more than $198000 will also be ineligible for any rebate. #TrahanTownHall

Those who earn $75000 or below will get the full rebate.  But the rebate is incrementally reduced for those who earn more than $75000 -- or couples who file jointly and earn more than $150000. #TrahanTownHall
The CARES Act includes direct cash payments -- called “recovery rebates” --  $1200 for each adult and $500 for each dependent child.  #TrahanTownHall

This is why I’ve introduced the Strengthen CTE in Higher Education Act a bill to foster greater cooperation and alignment between Perkins Career and Technical Education (CTE) programs and educational institutions and employers.
In addition to making college more affordable we must make necessary investments in community colleges vocational schools and apprenticeships.
There are many ways to achieve the American dream. We must expand the number of pathways available for students to find good-paying fulfilling jobs.  https://t.co/IqG0C0a3EO
